newsitem.title: USA: PacifiCorp saw Q3 electric customer growth.
newsitem.headline: PacifiCorp saw Q3 electric customer growth.

text.p: PacifiCorp said on Wednesday it saw growth in each of its major businesses during the third quarter, including a 2 percent increase in the average number of domestic retail electric customers.
The Portland, Ore.-based utility also reported 14 percent customer load growth at Powercor, its Australian electricity distribution and marketing company.

Earnings from the company's domestic electric operations increased 14 percent to $100 million. Domestic retail electric revenues were up 7 percent to $546 million, while associated energy sales volume rose 5 percent.
Despite lower energy prices, PacifiCorp said wholesale business also grew substantially in the quarter, with wholesale revenues and energy volumes up 45 percent and 86 percent, respectively.
Retail customer growth, price increases in the company's Oregon and Wyoming customer service territories and strong demand for power drove the increase in earnings.
Warmer and drier weather added an estimated $7 million, or $0.02 per share, to earnings in the quarter.

Fuel expense for the quarter was up slightly to $121 million, PacifiCorp said. Thermal generation was up 1 percent, to 13.3 million MWh. Hydroelectric generation increased 8 percent, to 712,400 MWh due to increased river flows.
